Neeldhara Misra is a Smt. Amba and Sri. V S Sastry Chair Associate Professor of Computer Science and Engineering at the Indian Institute of Technology, Gandhinagar. She completed her PhD from the Institute for Mathematical Sciences in 2012 in Theoretical Computer Science. Her research interests include the design and analysis of algorithms and computational social choice. She is also interested in visualizations and other methods to communicate computational thinking at an elementary level. She also enjoys learning about new card tricks, especially self-working ones --- even though she can't remember any!
